newsitem.title: CHINA: HK post-handover polls to be fair - future leader.
newsitem.headline: HK post-handover polls to be fair - future leader.

text.p: Hong Kong's future leader Tung Chee-hwa said on Friday the territory's elections after its return to Chinese rule at midnight on June 30 will be fair and democratic, but the final formula for filling legislative seats has not been determined.
"They (elections) will be open and based on the principle of fairness," Tung told a news conference in Beijing.

Tung said the government of Hong Kong's Special Administration Region, which will rule the territory after it reverts to Chinese rule on July 1, will decide on the formula used for filling their legislature based on recommendations from the Beijing-appointed Preparatory Committee.

The Preparatory Committee wound up its meetings in Beijing on Friday, giving Tung and the future regional government recommendations on how to fill the seats that will be generally selected by both direct and indirect methods.
Tung said he expected to see elections for the body in the second quarter of 1998.
He is expected to consult his advisers and the public before a decision on the elections is made.
